title: Tech Debt | Construct Design for In-House E-Mail Management [16 Hrs]
summary: In-House Email Management System Design Research Completed technical research and design work to replace SendGrid templating with a CX-owned in-house email management system for template creation and delivery. The spike evaluated architecture options, template management approaches, and sending infrastructure requirements to reduce vendor dependency and increase control over email customization. The recommended design establishes the foundation for an in-house email platform supporting dynamic branding, improved deliverability, and reduced SendGrid licensing costs. This research enables future development of a fully self-managed email solution.
fullDescription:
We desire to move away from SendGrid templating to an in-house system to manage e-mail templates and sending.  This would render SendGrid as nothing more than an e-mail server, as we would be managing the various e-mail templates ourselves and coding a solution to construct templates into fully-formed HTML to send to SendGrid.

We need to answer some questions around this work:

- The recommended implementation would use an Azure Function to process e-mail requests and send them off to SendGrid for delivery.  This would respond to Azure Service Bus queue messages.  Are there better options?
- How are we going to manage template HTML?  A suggestion was to use Razor pages, which gives us design-time capabilities within Visual Studio.  However, Azure Functions does not support Razor view rendering natively, so this requires research (e.g. [Razor Templating Engine to render Razor Views(.cshtml files)](https://github.com/soundaranbu/Razor.Templating.Core)).  If this is not possible/desirable, other solutions will be required.
- Templates would be stored in a database table, which combines the various Razor Page pieces into a unified e-mail.  Aside from the actual template-body data, additional metadata may be required to appropriately select a template to match branding/other requirements.

The outcome of this spike should be a recommendations/design document showing a proposed solution.  Further stories can then be created for implementation.
releaseNote:
In-House Email Management System Design Research

Completed technical research and design work to replace SendGrid templating with a CX-owned in-house email management system for template creation and delivery. The spike evaluated architecture options, template management approaches, and sending infrastructure requirements to reduce vendor dependency and increase control over email customization. The recommended design establishes the foundation for an in-house email platform supporting dynamic branding, improved deliverability, and reduced SendGrid licensing costs. This research enables future development of a fully self-managed email solution.

title: Tech Debt | Refactor login logic to ensure the loading indicator is not turned off until the user's dashboard is shown
summary: Improved Login Loading State Reliability Refactored the login loading indicator logic to ensure it remains visible until the user's dashboard has fully loaded. Previously, the loading indicator would occasionally disappear too early, causing the login screen to briefly reappear before navigating the user to their dashboard. This fix eliminates the visual flicker during login, resulting in a smoother and more reliable authentication experience for all users.
fullDescription:
Currently, on occasion when a user logs in the loading indicator is shown, but goes away to early showing the login component again for a brief period of time, before navigating the user to their dashboard.  This can be confusing and lead to the user clicking on something in the login component in that brief period before the dashboard loads.

Instead, we should continue to show the loading indicator until the dashboard is shown (after navigation has occurred.) 

A video is attached showing the behavior, which doesn't happen all the time, and seems to happen more often when your logging in for the first time.
releaseNote:
Improved Login Loading State Reliability

Refactored the login loading indicator logic to ensure it remains visible until the user's dashboard has fully loaded. Previously, the loading indicator would occasionally disappear too early, causing the login screen to briefly reappear before navigating the user to their dashboard. This fix eliminates the visual flicker during login, resulting in a smoother and more reliable authentication experience for all users.

title: Tech Debt | Deprecate FinancialsVerificationProvider
summary: Deprecated FinancialsVerificationProvider Cleanup Removed the FinancialsVerificationProvider from the CX codebase as part of ongoing technical debt reduction. Financial data previously sourced through this provider is now derived directly from borrower employment and asset data associated with loan applications. This change simplifies the data access layer and reduces maintenance overhead.
fullDescription:
With the shifting of decision for Financials Verification Provider from an app settings/feature flag based decision on the API to a purely feature flag-based decision on the UI, there will no longer be a need for the column `FinancialsVerificationProvider` in the `LoanApplication` table, or the `FinancialsVerificationProviderSelectionMode` app setting in the API. 

If the data is still needed for Loan Summaries or Pipeline Loan Applications, it can be determined from the borrower employments/assets associated with a loan application. 

DEVELOPER NOTE: As this will result in the destruction of data on existing loan application records, a pre-deploy script must be run dropping the column prior to API build/deploy.
releaseNote:
Deprecated FinancialsVerificationProvider Cleanup

Removed the FinancialsVerificationProvider from the CX codebase as part of ongoing technical debt reduction. Financial data previously sourced through this provider is now derived directly from borrower employment and asset data associated with loan applications. This change simplifies the data access layer and reduces maintenance overhead.

title: Tech Debt | Research on Improvement of performance of UI Unit Tests
summary: UI Unit Test Performance Research Investigated root causes of slow UI unit test execution and identified opportunities to improve test suite performance. The research analyzed test configuration, dependency loading, and parallelization options to reduce overall test run times. Findings will inform future optimizations to the CI/CD pipeline and developer workflow.
fullDescription: The UI Unit tests are still slow.  We should investigate what else can be done to improve the speed of the tests.  This can also include parallelizing the pipeline.
releaseNote:
UI Unit Test Performance Research

Investigated root causes of slow UI unit test execution and identified opportunities to improve test suite performance. The research analyzed test configuration, dependency loading, and parallelization options to reduce overall test run times. Findings will inform future optimizations to the CI/CD pipeline and developer workflow.

title: CX Partner Co-Branding | Admin Portal Change Loan Officer button to remove Co-Branded REA if new LO does not have them as an active partner
summary: As a Co-Branded REA: If the newly assigned Loan Officer is also connected with the partner with Co-Branding = Active, then the agent will remain assigned on the file as the Co-Branded REA You will need to call new endpoint most likely in CX API as this does the swap: GET /api/v1/external/partnerloanofficers/search?LoanOfficerNMLS={nmls} so you can check partner guids on LOs to partners on loan applications. If the newly assigned Loan Officer is NOT connected with the partner or if they are connected with Co-Branding = Inactive, then the agent will be removed so that they are no longer assigned on the file as the Co-Branded REA (and will therefore no longer see the file listed in their Your Clients page of the Partner Portal) Existing audit tracking will capture **RemovedFromApplication** audit event, Co-Branded REA is removed from the application No email notification will be sent to notify of the Co-Branded REA removal Newly assigned Loan Officer can then manage the assignment of the correct Co-Branded REA on the file via Clear If application does NOT have a Co-Branded REA: No additional behavior will occur (i.
fullDescription:
Acceptance Criteria:
Perform the following:
  1. Update existing Change Loan Officer modal in the CX Admin Portal Home Portal tab (accessed by clicking enabled Change Loan Officer button when non-corporate in-progress SmartApp application row is checked) so that:
    1. If the file does NOT have a Co-Branded REA partner, then no changes (modal will continue to display as it does today)
      1. This relationship is CX (LoanApplication -> LoanApplicationPartner)
    2. If the file DOES have a Co-Branded REA partner, then:
      1. Co-Branded REA "{Partner Contact First Name} {Partner Contact Last Name} ({Partner Account Email if populated, otherwise Partner Contact Email})" will be displayed below Borrower Name as depicted in the mockup
        1. We may have to consider to call Partner Portal directly or have CX Hydrate the partner for us.
      2. Italicized label in red font will be displayed below the Co-Branded REA as depicted in the mockup stating the following: 

        Warning:  Co-branding partners will be removed if the new Loan Officer does not also have an active co-branding connection with them. 
  2. Update Change Loan Officer behavior in the CX Admin Portal Home Portal tab so that upon Confirm button being successfully clicked in the Change Loan Officer modal, the following additional logic and behavior will occur:
    1. If application has a Co-Branded REA:
      1. If the newly assigned Loan Officer is also connected with the partner with Co-Branding = Active, then the agent will remain assigned on the file as the Co-Branded REA
        1. You will need to call new endpoint most likely in CX API as this does the swap: GET /api/v1/external/partnerloanofficers/search?LoanOfficerNMLS={nmls} so you can check partner guids on LOs to partners on loan applications.
      2. If the newly assigned Loan Officer is NOT connected with the partner or if they are connected with Co-Branding = Inactive, then the agent will be removed so that they are no longer assigned on the file as the Co-Branded REA  (and will therefore no longer see the file listed in their Your Clients page of the Partner Portal)
        1. Existing audit tracking will capture **RemovedFromApplication** audit event when Co-Branded REA is removed from the application
        2. No email notification will be sent to notify of the Co-Branded REA removal
        3. Newly assigned Loan Officer can then manage the assignment of the correct Co-Branded REA on the file via Clear

    2. If application does NOT have a Co-Branded REA:
      1. No additional behavior will occur (i.e., same logic that applies today will occur with Loan Officer changed on the application)

Note: Similar logic for Co-Branded REA handling on Loan Officer changes in Byte is being handled in #92824

title: Servicing | Add Banner for 1098 - After Delivery
summary: 1098 Tax Form Delivery Banner in Servicing Portal Added an informational banner to the Servicing Portal that displays after a borrower's 1098 tax form has been delivered. The banner notifies servicing clients that their tax document is available, improving borrower awareness and reducing support inquiries during tax season. The banner displays to all applicable servicing clients once the 1098 delivery event is triggered.
fullDescription:
REMOVE the current Blue announcement banner to mortgage accounts in servicing.  Location at top of screen.
ADD a Green Announcement banner to mortgage accounts in servicing.  Location at top of screen. (same location as current)

Copy:  
"Your Form 1098 tax statement is being ready. View or download it now from the Documents Center. A printed copy has also been mailed.

Important - If you received more than one Form 1098 from CMG for this loan: Please use only the most recent form in the Documents Center. It replaces any earlier partial year form you may have received in the mail from CMG. It will be mailed to you and available in the Documents Center by January 31."
Acceptance Criteria:
  • Banner is present for all servicing clients as expected
releaseNote:
1098 Tax Form Delivery Banner in Servicing Portal

Added an informational banner to the Servicing Portal that displays after a borrower's 1098 tax form has been delivered. The banner notifies servicing clients that their tax document is available, improving borrower awareness and reducing support inquiries during tax season. The banner displays to all applicable servicing clients once the 1098 delivery event is triggered.

title: Home Portal | Add 'IRS Form 1099-INT � Mortgage Interest Statement' to Documents
summary: IRS Form 1099-INT Added to Home Portal Documents Added the IRS Form 1099-INT (Mortgage Interest Statement) as a new document type accessible through the Home Portal Documents page. Borrowers can now view and download their annual mortgage interest statement directly from the portal, eliminating the need to contact support for this commonly requested document. This enhancement improves the self-service document experience during tax season.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement:
As a user, I want to be able to access additional document types so that I can view them without contacting support.

Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Upon accessing the Documents page for a loan, the following additional document type will be returned:
    1. IRS Form 1099-INT � Mortgage Interest Statement
      1. GUID: 63e8a3a3-6f67-496d-9ab9-d5a50090a53a
  2. IRS Form 1099-INT � Mortgage Interest Statement documents will be included when the user selects Statements in Filter By.
releaseNote:
IRS Form 1099-INT Added to Home Portal Documents

Added the IRS Form 1099-INT (Mortgage Interest Statement) as a new document type accessible through the Home Portal Documents page. Borrowers can now view and download their annual mortgage interest statement directly from the portal, eliminating the need to contact support for this commonly requested document. This enhancement improves the self-service document experience during tax season.

title: Sitewide | Announcements - Extend character count
summary: Increased Announcement Character Limit to 2,000 Extended the maximum character count for sitewide announcements to 2,000 characters. This change allows administrators to create more detailed and informative announcements for borrowers and users across the platform, supporting richer communication without requiring external links for longer messages.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement:  We currently have announcements set to:
  • character count as 255
The business will sometimes ask that certain announcements that extend beyond 255.

Here is an example of a message that we had to cut down to 255:



Acceptance Criteria:
  • Announcements to extend to 2000 character count
releaseNote:
Increased Announcement Character Limit to 2,000

Extended the maximum character count for sitewide announcements to 2,000 characters. This change allows administrators to create more detailed and informative announcements for borrowers and users across the platform, supporting richer communication without requiring external links for longer messages.

title: Servicing | Upgrade Aspen Grove widgets to 1.51.0
summary: Aspen Grove Servicing Widgets Upgraded to v1.51.0 Upgraded the Aspen Grove third-party servicing widgets to version 1.51.0, incorporating Sagent-confirmed payload changes required for Escrow Shortage-only payment request submissions. This update ensures accurate escrow payment processing and improves compatibility with the Sagent servicing platform. Borrowers will experience improved reliability when interacting with escrow-related servicing features.
fullDescription:
This release introduces a new feature: Escrow Shortage Payments:

 

(Escrow detail Widget)

 

(Payment Widget)


There is a complete end-to-end flow starting in the Escrow Widget, where the shortage message is displayed, and redirecting the user to the Payment screen to complete an escrow-shortage-only payment.

 

We experienced a small delay while waiting for Sagent to confirm the exact payload required to submit an Escrow Shortage�only payment request (thanks, Jim Rasmussen, for coordinating this).

 

Additionally, after CMG QA identified some inconsistencies with specific payment scenarios, we raised the issue with Sagent. They informed us of a new required field for the implementation: paymentBreakdownItemsSelected, which provides a detailed breakdown of the payment.
This represents a breaking change affecting all payment types and was not previously communicated. 

Because of this, this release - more than others - requires full and thorough regression testing across all payment scenarios.

 

Some of the scenarios I have personally tested include:

  • Escrow shortage only (full amount)
  • Escrow shortage + monthly payment
  • Escrow shortage + additional principal
  • Escrow shortage + additional principal + monthly payment
  • Escrow shortage + fees
  • Escrow shortage + fees + additional principal
  • Escrow shortage + fees + additional principal + monthly payment

All of the above tests were performed using an account that is not currently due, as the staged account provided has a due date in February.


QA will also need to validate these flows - and additional scenarios -using an account that is past due, specifically for late January.

 

We are still awaiting further documentation from Sagent (via Jim) to confirm that the payment type sent within the paymentBreakdownItemsSelected payload is fully consistent with the intended operation. 

However, we chose not to delay the release further while waiting for this information.

 

This version also includes fixes for the following items:

  • AP 1.72: Bi-Weekly Starting Draft Date Selection
  • OTP 1.69: Monthly Payment Amount Not Auto-Checked
  • OTP 1.71: Maximum Payment Limit
  • OTP 1.70: Invalid Date Selection Messaging

Thanks all!
releaseNote:
Aspen Grove Servicing Widgets Upgraded to v1.51.0

Upgraded the Aspen Grove third-party servicing widgets to version 1.51.0, incorporating Sagent-confirmed payload changes required for Escrow Shortage-only payment request submissions. This update ensures accurate escrow payment processing and improves compatibility with the Sagent servicing platform. Borrowers will experience improved reliability when interacting with escrow-related servicing features.

title: Servicing | Upgrade Aspen Grove widgets to 1.52.0
summary: Aspen Grove Servicing Widgets Upgraded to v1.52.0 Upgraded the Aspen Grove third-party servicing widgets to version 1.52.0, which addresses stability issues introduced in v1.51.0. This patch update ensures continued reliability of escrow and payment servicing features for borrowers.
fullDescription: Bugfix addressing issues with 1.51.0, which was handled in #93601
releaseNote:
Aspen Grove Servicing Widgets Upgraded to v1.52.0

Upgraded the Aspen Grove third-party servicing widgets to version 1.52.0, which addresses stability issues introduced in v1.51.0. This patch update ensures continued reliability of escrow and payment servicing features for borrowers.

title: Servicing | 1098 issue in Production
summary: Resolved 1098 Tax Document Loading Issue in Production Fixed a production issue where 1098 year-end tax documents were not loading correctly in the Servicing Portal. Borrowers affected by this issue can now access their 1098 mortgage interest statements without errors, ensuring tax document availability aligns with IRS delivery timelines.
fullDescription:
PENDING DECISION FROM BUSINESS IF NECESSARY

PROBLEM STATEMENT:

There was issue when 1098-year end tax documents were loaded for servicing documents.  the file name did not include the expected naming and it is causing issues loading for consumers. 

This issue has been fixed on the servicing docs side as of 1/29/26, but we will be adding the logic mentioned below as a second layer of defense in case we ever get data returned in this manner again.


NOTE FROM CORY:  my proposed solution on our end is to force the mimeType to be PDF if the mimeType is:

  • A.) fileExtension provided from docs is "pdf"  
  • B.) and the mimeType is not pdf

     This should allow the file to be opened as a pdf, as long as the file is truly a pdf.
releaseNote:
Resolved 1098 Tax Document Loading Issue in Production

Fixed a production issue where 1098 year-end tax documents were not loading correctly in the Servicing Portal. Borrowers affected by this issue can now access their 1098 mortgage interest statements without errors, ensuring tax document availability aligns with IRS delivery timelines.

title: Sitewide | Bank CMG Branding on LO Emails, Emails to Borrower +Misc Emails not already covered
summary: Bank CMG Email Branding Applied Across All Remaining Emails Applied Bank CMG co-branding to all remaining loan officer and borrower-facing emails originating from the Bank CMG domain that were not previously branded. Loan officers and borrowers interacting through Bank CMG now receive fully co-branded email communications consistent with the Bank CMG identity. This completes the Bank CMG email branding initiative across the SmartApp notification workflow.
fullDescription:
1) As a loan officer, I want emails from a Bank CMG domain to reflect Bank CMG's branding so that I can ensure these emails are from Bank CMG.

2) As a borrower, I want emails triggered from a Bank CMG domain to reflect Bank CMG's branding so that I can ensure these emails are from Bank CMG.

Acceptance Criteria for 1:  wiki:  https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/Consumer%20Experience/_wiki/wikis/Consumer-Experience.wiki/373/Email-Notifications
  1. All Emails to LOs from the Bank CMG domain (Smart App or Home Portal) have updated branding. This includes:
    1. Abandoned Loan Application 
    2. Finished Loan Application to Loan Officers
    3. Finished Loan Application to Clear 2 Pipeline Users
    4. Failed Loan Creation to Clear 2 Pipeline Users
    5. Change Loan Officer
    6. Loan Application Started 
  2. Email branding updates include:
    1. Header: Bank CMG banner 
    2. Email body: Replacement of the text "CMG Home Loans" (if applicable)
    3. Contact: Support reflects Bank CMG URL contact
    4. Footer: replacement of "CMG Home Loans" text to Bank CMG 
Acceptance Criteria for 2: (see screen shots of emails below AC)
  1. Bank CMG "Welcome!" Email Updates:
    1. Body of email: Replace copy with: 

      "Thank you for starting your mortgage application with us. You can revisit your application anytime. If you haven't activated your account yet, click the button below.

      Activate your account to:"

    2. Questions/support section: Replace connect@cmghomeloans.com with bankcmg.com 
  2. Bank CMG "Congratulations!" Email Update:
    1. Title/Header: Replace "Congratulations!" with: "Application Received"
    2. Body: Update copy to: 

      "Thank you for submitting your application with us!

      Your loan officer will contact you within the next few days by email or phone. You'll also receive email updates throughout the application process."

    3. If you have any question regarding your application, please reach out directly. We look forward to working with you! Thank you!
releaseNote:
Bank CMG Email Branding Applied Across All Remaining Emails

Applied Bank CMG co-branding to all remaining loan officer and borrower-facing emails originating from the Bank CMG domain that were not previously branded. Loan officers and borrowers interacting through Bank CMG now receive fully co-branded email communications consistent with the Bank CMG identity. This completes the Bank CMG email branding initiative across the SmartApp notification workflow.

Aspen Grove Servicing Widgets Upgraded to v1.53.0

Upgraded the Aspen Grove third-party servicing widgets to version 1.53.0, delivering continued stability improvements to the servicing widget suite. Borrowers will experience improved reliability across escrow and payment-related servicing features.

title: Home Portal | Remove error message when loan detail returns 404, prevent navigation to specific loan detail on login
summary: Improved Handling of Unavailable Loan Detail Pages Resolved an issue where borrowers following an outdated or bookmarked loan detail link would see a confusing red error message. The portal now gracefully handles unavailable loan detail pages by redirecting users to their dashboard instead of displaying an error. This improves the login and navigation experience for borrowers with inactive or transferred loans.
fullDescription:
As a user, I can be confused by the red error message when following an obsolete link and logging in. Removing this message if the loan is not found will remove a distraction preventing some users from accessing their loans.  
  
In addition, in situations where the user has bookmarked a specific loan detail dashboard and we no longer utilize that scheme for pulling servicing loan data, this results in unnecessary calls to the API, cluttering AppInsights with failures.  
  
AC 1: On logging in to an application via a link to a loan detail, e.g. [https://uat.secure.cmghomeloans.com/dashboard/3000000052RNT0000036447](https://uat.secure.cmghomeloans.com/dashboard/3000000052RNT0000036447), the information about the detail should be disregarded and the user should instead land on the default dashboard, [https://uat.secure.cmghome.loans.com/dashboard](https://uat.secure.cmghome.loans.com/dashboard) .  
  
AC 2: On logging in to an application via an obsolete link to a loan detail, e.g. [https://uat.secure.cmghomeloans.com/dashboard/de458a15-5c90-4b5a-851f-f80117394a41](https://uat.secure.cmghomeloans.com/dashboard/de458a15-5c90-4b5a-851f-f80117394a41), the error message displayed to the user in this screenshot should no longer appear:![Image](https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/84000f10-6c77-4628-a772-531c4c796272/_apis/wit/attachments/b7f685a1-e4f1-48bb-b728-50fd7a578def?fileName=image.png)  
  
AC 3: After authentication, bookmarks to a specific loan detail page should still be respected.  
If logging in with user `micdrop@AG.com` password `Jimmynoodle12!`, a bookmark to [https://uat.secure.cmghomeloans.com/dashboard/3000000052RNT0000036447](https://uat.secure.cmghomeloans.com/dashboard/3000000052RNT0000036447) should land the user on that page.
releaseNote:
Improved Handling of Unavailable Loan Detail Pages

Resolved an issue where borrowers following an outdated or bookmarked loan detail link would see a confusing red error message. The portal now gracefully handles unavailable loan detail pages by redirecting users to their dashboard instead of displaying an error. This improves the login and navigation experience for borrowers with inactive or transferred loans.

title: Home Portal | Workflow - Borrower Auth Doc Request - Data Fix
summary: Fixed Borrower Authentication Document Request Data Corrected a data issue in the Borrower Authentication Document Request workflow within SmartApp. The fix ensures that submitted application data is accurately passed through to the authentication document request process, preventing downstream data mismatches during the loan application flow.
fullDescription:
1. Issue: Requesting the Pre-Disclosure EConsent disclosure package is causing an LE/CD Log entry to be made in Byte.
  2. Solution: We need to make an update to the call for the Borrower's Authorization to Verify disclosure package made when the borrower submits a Smart App.
    1. Fields to be updated
      1. eNoteIndicator = false
      2. disclose = false
    2. No other updates will be made to the payload, nor to the workflow that triggers the api call.
POST /Disclosures/OrderDisclosures 
{   
"fileDataID": <byteLoanId>,   
"selfDisclosedBy": "ConsumerExperience",   
"docPackageVendor": 
"Auto",   "packageType": 1672,  // Pre-Disclosure  
"deliveryOption": 2,  // E-Sign   
"secureEmailAddress":, // empty   
"eNoteIndicator": false,   
"disclose": false 
}

Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Create and Submit an application from Smart App
  2. Verify the following
    1. When the ordBorrAuth feature flag is ON, 
      1. a Borrower's Authorization to Verify eSign task is created and displayed in the tasks screen
        1. Note: Requires the eSignTask feature flag to be enabled.
      2. In Byte, the Pre-Disclosure Package is created and displays in the Document Preparation screen

      3. In Byte, the LE Page 1 shows no log entries for the LE/CD (The highlighted area below should be empty).

    2. When the ordBorrAuth feature flag is OFF, no task or package is created.
Production prior to update - Need to enable the ordBorrAuth feature flag.
releaseNote:
Fixed Borrower Authentication Document Request Data

Corrected a data issue in the Borrower Authentication Document Request workflow within SmartApp. The fix ensures that submitted application data is accurately passed through to the authentication document request process, preventing downstream data mismatches during the loan application flow.

title: Tech Debt | Fix loan details dashboard skeleton
summary: Restored Loan Details Dashboard Loading Skeleton Restored the skeleton loading component on the Loan Detail dashboard page, which had been inadvertently removed. The skeleton screen now displays while loan data is loading, providing users with a visual loading indicator and preventing layout shifts. This improves the perceived performance and visual consistency of the loan detail experience.
fullDescription:
The skeleton component on the Loan Detail page was removed/disabled and needs to be restored. Currently, while the loan data is being fetched, the page renders empty, which results in a poor user experience and may give the impression that the page is broken or stuck loading.

Expected Outcome:

  • The Loan Detail page should display a skeleton/loading state while the loan data is being loaded.

  • The user should not see a blank page during the data fetch process.
releaseNote:
Restored Loan Details Dashboard Loading Skeleton

Restored the skeleton loading component on the Loan Detail dashboard page, which had been inadvertently removed. The skeleton screen now displays while loan data is loading, providing users with a visual loading indicator and preventing layout shifts. This improves the perceived performance and visual consistency of the loan detail experience.

title: Sitewide | Create a console app to call submitted loan apps migration endpoint to support Bank Loan Copy project
summary: Submitted Loan Applications Migration Console App Built a console application that processes loan lists generated during the Bank Loan Copy orchestration run and calls the submitted loan applications migration endpoint for each affected loan. This tool enables CX engineers to retry and complete migration steps that previously failed due to missing targetLO data during orchestration. The application directly supports the Bank Loan Copy project by ensuring all affected loan applications are fully migrated, reducing manual intervention and improving data integrity across the platform.
fullDescription:
As a CX developer,
I want to build a console application that processes the list of loans generated by Theo�s team during the orchestration run and calls the submitted loan applications migration endpoint,
so that CX migration steps that failed because of missing targetLO data during orchestration can be retried and completed successfully.

Technical Notes: 

The console application reads the list of loans to be migrated from a JSON file.
This JSON file is generated by aggregating orchestration log data stored in a SQLite database.

Each JSON object in the file represents a single loan migration record, including source and target identifiers, loan officer details, borrower mappings, and associated documents.

    "SourceFileDataID": "4182575",

    "TargetFileDataName": "BTST000000828",
    "TargetLODomoID": "",

    "RunInReadMode": false,

    ],

    "SourceLoanGUID": "800dd897-d098-498c-8bd0-3a93496cf8eb",

releaseNote:
Submitted Loan Applications Migration Console App

Built a console application that processes loan lists generated during the Bank Loan Copy orchestration run and calls the submitted loan applications migration endpoint for each affected loan. This tool enables CX engineers to retry and complete migration steps that previously failed due to missing targetLO data during orchestration. The application directly supports the Bank Loan Copy project by ensuring all affected loan applications are fully migrated, reducing manual intervention and improving data integrity across the platform.

title: Servicing | Upgrade Aspen Grove widgets to 1.54.0
summary: Aspen Grove Servicing Widgets Upgraded to v1.54.0 Upgraded the Aspen Grove third-party servicing widgets to version 1.54.0, incorporating several user-facing improvements including enhanced messaging in Escrow Details (ESC 1.21), a disabled Set Up AutoPay CTA state (STO 1.4), updated shortage messaging on the main Escrow container (ESC 1.20), and additional escrow-related fixes (STO 1.3). These enhancements improve the clarity and usability of escrow and autopay features for servicing borrowers.
fullDescription:
This version includes feedback of the following items: 

  • ESC 1.21: Messaging in Escrow Details  
  • STO 1.4: Set Up AutoPay CTA Disabled 
  • ESC 1.20: Shortage Messaging on Main Escrow Container
  • STO 1.3: Escrow Messaging - Escrow Details

STO 1.5: Payment Date Selection: This will be included soon - on the next release -, the development has been done locally mocking the data, until we have the right data integrated from LoanServ.
releaseNote:
Aspen Grove Servicing Widgets Upgraded to v1.54.0

Upgraded the Aspen Grove third-party servicing widgets to version 1.54.0, incorporating several user-facing improvements including enhanced messaging in Escrow Details (ESC 1.21), a disabled Set Up AutoPay CTA state (STO 1.4), updated shortage messaging on the main Escrow container (ESC 1.20), and additional escrow-related fixes (STO 1.3). These enhancements improve the clarity and usability of escrow and autopay features for servicing borrowers.

title: Tech Debt | Fix API Build running out of disk space
summary: Resolved API Build Pipeline Disk Space Issue Fixed a recurring issue where the API build pipeline was running out of disk space, causing build failures and blocking deployments. The root cause was identified and resolved by implementing disk cleanup and optimizing build artifact management within the pipeline. This fix restores build reliability and prevents future deployment interruptions caused by insufficient disk capacity.
fullDescription: API Pipeline is running out of disk space, causing the build to fail.
releaseNote:
Resolved API Build Pipeline Disk Space Issue

Fixed a recurring issue where the API build pipeline was running out of disk space, causing build failures and blocking deployments. The root cause was identified and resolved by implementing disk cleanup and optimizing build artifact management within the pipeline. This fix restores build reliability and prevents future deployment interruptions caused by insufficient disk capacity.
